Noun: metal device shaped in such a way that when it is inserted into the appropriate lock the lock's mechanism can be rotated
any of 24 major or minor diatonic scales that provide the tonal framework for a piece of music
a kilogram of a narcotic drug
a winged often one-seed indehiscent fruit as of the ash or elm or maple

United States lawyer and poet who wrote a poem after witnessing the British attack on Baltimore during the War of 1812; the poem was later set to music and entitled `The Star-Spangled Banner' (1779-184)
a coral reef off the southern coast of Florida
a list of answers to a test
a list of words or phrases that explain symbols or abbreviations
a generic term for any device whose possession entitles the holder to a means of access
mechanical device used to wind another device that is driven by a spring (as a cloc)
the central building block at the top of an arch or vault
Verb: identify as in botany or biology, for example
vandalize a car by scratching the sides with a key
